name: Rice Cooker Chili
description: This small batch, scaled back, and super easy Rice Cooker Chili still delivers huge flavor. Perfect for dorm living, RV's, and hotel cooking!

recipeInstructions.text: Add the olive oil and ground beef to the rice cooker. Close the lid and select the "white rice" or "cook" function, depending on the functions available on your cooker. Allow the beef to cook with the lid closed, opening it briefly to stir and break up the meat every couple of minutes, until the beef is fully browned (about 5 minutes total). Many rice cookers, including the model I used, do not heat unless the lid is closed, so remember to close it after each stir.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the olive oil and ground beef to the rice cooker. Close the lid and select the "white rice" or "cook" function, depending on the functions available on your cooker. Allow the beef to cook with the lid closed, opening it briefly to stir and break up the meat every couple of minutes, until the beef is fully browned (about 5 minutes total). Many rice cookers, including the model I used, do not heat unless the lid is closed, so remember to close it after each stir.

recipeInstructions.text: If you are using a higher fat content beef, drain the excess fat once it has fully browned. Add the chili powder, cumin, cayenne, garlic powder, onion powder, brown sugar, salt, and pepper to the ground beef in the rice cooker, stir to combine, then close the lid and cook for one minute more.
recipeInstructions.name: If you are using a higher fat content beef, drain the excess fat once it has fully browned. Add the chili powder, cumin, cayenne, garlic powder, onion powder, brown sugar, salt, and pepper to the ground beef in the rice cooker, stir to combine, then close the lid and cook for one minute more.

recipeInstructions.text: Drain the can of kidney beans and add them to the rice cooker along with the diced tomatoes (and their juices), tomato paste, and water. Stir until everything is evenly combined.
recipeInstructions.name: Drain the can of kidney beans and add them to the rice cooker along with the diced tomatoes (and their juices), tomato paste, and water. Stir until everything is evenly combined.

recipeInstructions.text: Close the lid once more, make sure "white rice" or "cook" is selected, then let the chili simmer for 30 minutes. Stir the chili occasionally to make sure it is not sticking on the bottom. If your cooker finishes the cook cycle before 30 minutes is up, simply begin it again.
recipeInstructions.name: Close the lid once more, make sure "white rice" or "cook" is selected, then let the chili simmer for 30 minutes. Stir the chili occasionally to make sure it is not sticking on the bottom. If your cooker finishes the cook cycle before 30 minutes is up, simply begin it again.

recipeInstructions.text: After simmering for 30 minutes, taste the chili, adjust the seasoning if desired, then serve with your favorite chili toppings.
recipeInstructions.name: After simmering for 30 minutes, taste the chili, adjust the seasoning if desired, then serve with your favorite chili toppings.

review.reviewBody: I was hoping to see how I coukd heat up chili in a rice cooker for a man who lives in one room in a motel and doesn't have a microwave.  I was thrilled to find your recipe for how to make a chili in a rice cooker. I am giving him a Cuisinart 4-cup rice cooker, and will adapt your recipe downward in size and try to report back to you. Thank you!!!

Great way to make a good meal for two while RVing.
Thank you.
I loooove you! Thank you for this simple recipe. I recently got an Aroma with the intent to find and make 1-pot meals. Yours is Â the first
This recipe is pretty great. I've started making it pretty consistently. Kids love it. Thanks.

A few days ago my mother introduced me to this site. I'm her 13 year old daughter and have enjoyed cooking, and recently got more into it. I've been learning to budget and spread out meals; and my mom came to a decision. She allowed me to choose 2 different meals from here, and this Rice Cooker Chili was one of them. Today I made it. We have a family of 4, so the recipe got doubled. Instead of using a rice cooker, however, we used a 6 Quart Sauce Pot. It worked out well and the only thing I did differently to the recipe was add in a quarter cup of minced onion and 5 cloves of garlic. This added to the flavor of the Chili. Overall this recipe was delicious, and I'm quite positive my family is full and satisfied with it. It's definitely a keeper, it's going in our recipe binder!! 

Thanks for this wonderful recipe!
    -Keegan

Hello, if I would like to double the recipe because I have the 20 cup aroma rice cooker, would you know how long to cook everything for? Thanks so much, just reading this recipe made me so hungry, sounds delicious!
There are two types of olive oil extra virgin olive oil and pomace olive oil which one i have to use for better taste
